thread.title: Wayne Rooney returns to Manchester United training as Jose Mourinho prepares to rotate squad for Reading clash
thread.title_full: Wayne Rooney returns to Manchester United training as Jose Mourinho prepares to rotate squad for Reading clash

author: Aaron Flanagan
title: Wayne Rooney returns to Manchester United training as Jose Mourinho prepares to rotate squad for Reading clash
text:
Sport Wayne Rooney returns to Manchester United training as Jose Mourinho prepares to rotate squad for Reading clash United welcome former defender Jaap Stam back to Old Trafford when he manages Reading in the FA Cup on Saturday Share Get Manchester United FC   Thank you for subscribing!   
Wayne Rooney has returned to Manchester United training ahead of the visit of Reading this weekend. 
Championship side Reading are the visitors to Old Trafford in the FA Cup on Saturday, managed by former United defender Jaap Stam. 
Manager Jose Mourinho took training on Thursday as his squad prepare for the third round clash. 
The Portuguese boss has won the FA Cup once before, claiming the 2007 crown with Chelsea, defeating United in the final. 
Rooney returned to training after missing the wins over Sunderland, Middlesbrough and West Ham. Rooney with Michael Carrick during training (Photo: Manchester United/Getty Images) Timothy Fosu-Mensah, Anthony Martial and Paul Pogba (Photo: Manchester United/Getty Images) Ashley Young stretches during training (Photo: Manchester United/Getty Images) 
He is back available for selection this weekend, but Mourinho is expected to give some of the club's young talent the opportunity to shine. 
Marcus Rashford is in line for a start, while Axel Tuanzebe, the Under-23 team captain, could be drafted in for a chance in the senior ranks. 
Fringe players Luke Shaw and Timothy Fosu-Mensah are also back in contention for a starting berth. Paul Pogba tries to keep warm (Photo: Manchester United/Getty Images) Sergio Romero and Marouane Fellaini (Photo: Manchester United/Getty Images) Jesse Lingard smiles during the session (Photo: Manchester United/Getty Images) Jose Mourinho looks on (Photo: Manchester United/Getty Images) 
Opposing boss Stam says that he is looking forward to his return to Old Trafford - but insists he is more excited about facing off against Mourinho. 
"I like the way he works and what he does for the team - he gets things going," Stam said. 
"I've spoken to him a couple of times and he's a great manager. I admire all the success he has had and the trophies he's won. Rooney keeps warm in the cold conditions at Carrington (Photo: Manchester United/Getty Images) Luke Shaw and Ashley Young keep each other upright (Photo: Manchester United/Getty Images) Henrikh Mkhitaryan prepares for training (Photo: Manchester United/Getty Images) 
"Hopefully I can be up there as well at some point, but I still have a long way to go. It is good to play against managers like that because you can learn something." 
Another former United defender will be heading back to Old Trafford, as Tyler Blackett is expected to play at the centre of defence for Reading. 
The youngster made the move to the Madjeski Stadium in the summer. Like us on Facebook
